website_summaries.verdict: Works well with both standard and narrow sized cards. Easy to use with one-button operation.
pros: Will shuffle up to 6 decks at one time, but also good for just one or two decks
Seems to work better with newer cards that haven't seen a lot of wear
cons: Above average noise level when running

customer_reviews.title: But it seems ALL the battery shufflers like this come from the exact same manufacturer - in ...
customer_reviews.text: A spring in one of the battery areas was missing when it arrived. This shuffler lasted the longest of any we've purchased in the past - bought it before and it lasted two years. But it seems ALL the battery shufflers like this come from the exact same manufacturer - in China <sigh> I returned it - no problem there, and purchased another which is fine.
customer_reviews.author: BakinBitsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: so that is good.
customer_reviews.text: This is actually the second time that I have purchase this. The belts wear down in time. Even though it has lasted for quite a few months with a regular daily use, I wish it lasted longer. It does the job of what you want it to do.....so that is good.
customer_reviews.author: william&Tammie

customer_reviews.title: They made it RIGHT!
customer_reviews.text: Received card shuffler and the lever was tucked way back out of sight. Fished it out and it worked for about 2 weeks and it stopped working. Contacted E-Brands directly and they immediately sent us a replacement, which is working great! We love our card shuffler. We play Samba and it requires 6 decks of cards.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: works...
customer_reviews.text: It's a little noisy and I'm guessing that's do to it's cheap parts and assembly but, what can you really expect for the price. I have used it quite extensively with very heavy use while playing a card game that has well over 400 cards. Cards against humanity in case your wondering with all the expansion packs and it's the funniest damn card game ever!!!! Funniest game ever!!!! PERIOD. It worked shuffling all those so I guess it's doing good.
customer_reviews.author: Targablade

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product and too late to return
customer_reviews.text: Arrived late June and used 7 or 8 times. Was great. And then...nothing. I changed the batteries. Nothing. I kept taking out and putting back the batteries in different slots. Still nothing. Return window has passed. Wish I could give this negative stars. This was actually my second purchase. The first one arrived in a large package with dog treats but the shuffler wasn't even its own box or wrapped. Just thrown in the package. Shoddy. Not at all like Amazon. But it came from Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Lexie's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good and Bad of It.
customer_reviews.text: First purchase worked fine. Second unit later bought as a gift did not work. Returned for exchange, and exchange unit did not work. I made sure batteries were properly installed. I did notice that the on/off paddle was very loose on each malfunctioning unit, compared to the working unit. I'm not in the fix-it business so I returned second exchange for a refund. Too bad - the first purchase still works fine, but no more trips to the well for this old dog. P.S. I am an Amazon fan. They handled return/exchange well. Good Folks
customer_reviews.author: Senior Citizen

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: We play card games with friends on camping trips. some of the games call for as many as 6 decks of cards. Can you imagine trying to handle that many cards? Yes we used to do them in smaller piles, but this changed all that. We just pile them all in this little machine and push the button. do that 3 or 4 times and your done. This makesthe games go faster and gives us more time by the campfire in the evening.
customer_reviews.author: James B. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: This card shuffler really doesn't work very well.
customer_reviews.text: We used this card shuffler to play Hand & Foot with five decks of cards. The shuffler is described as handling six decks of cards. The first time we used the shuffler it worked pretty well. The second time we used it, it hardly worked at all, so we replaced the batteries and it worked fairly well. When we used it a third time, it was difficult to get the shuffle button to work properly - it was really sluggish. We wouldn't recommend this shuffler - it should work better (as advertised).
customer_reviews.author: Karen Johnston

customer_reviews.title: but generally pretty reliable. Be careful with the transparent plastic piece ...
customer_reviews.text: Kinda flimsy and jams up sometimes, but generally pretty reliable. Be careful with the transparent plastic piece that catches the cards. If it jams up, tap the button a few times and frequently it'll loosen up. Great for the price. I use it for Cards Against Humanity, but it seems like it'll work with anything not taller than an average playing card.
customer_reviews.author: Wes B.

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO USE
customer_reviews.text: What I like about this product is it is so easy to use. Split the deck in half, load it and away we GO! Just remember this, when cards are worn the cards will become harder to shuffle. You need to buy new cards or shuffle the old cards by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Joe   Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable product .
customer_reviews.text: This shuffler has been known to have problems according to my Canasta group . I first thought it was a problem with my batteries and replaced them . Then I tried replacing my cards with older ones and lastly my other players worked with mine and said it’s definitely defective ! Being new at Canasta I figured it was operator error ! I spoken with other players who’ve said they’ve had to return this product and encouraged me to contact Amazon !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is so handy for an inexpensive shuffler. It ...
customer_reviews.text: This is so handy for an inexpensive shuffler. It does get stuck ever so often, but it's a quick fix by pulling out the card that jammed. It does what we need it to for home use. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Baake

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Got this about a year ago. Works great. We use it every week when we get together and play cards. Battery life is good.. haven’t had to change them. Looks a little flimsy, but holding up well so far!
customer_reviews.author: Linda H.

customer_reviews.title: Love my shuffler
customer_reviews.text: I love my shuffler. I have RA and have issues with shuffling so I bought this shuffler based on others reviews. I have had this for over 2 years and it is still going strong. Very few miss feeds and I love being able to shuffle when it comes to my turn without having someone else do it for me. I do get the occasional smart allelic comment about my Vegas shuffler, but I go with the flow and dish it back . Would certainly recommend this shuffler to others!
customer_reviews.author: Mtnewts

customer_reviews.title: Much better than shuffling 8 decks by hand.
customer_reviews.text: We play version of canasta with 8 decks of cards and this thing is still going. I think we are on our 4th set of batteries for it as we have used it so much. We purchased a second one for our friends that play with us and haven't had any issues with it. It is fast and works well. The only problem I every have is it occasionally have a card get stuck to the side and flip it the wrong way in the deck. It isn't a big deal. We have so many cards that we have to split the cards into two piles It won't quite hold 8 decks.
customer_reviews.author: A Little Bit Of Everything

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed with the performance of this shuffler. Had it quite awhile before I had the opportunity to use it and missed the return window. I have another one that I bought at a flea market in Florida that performs 100 percent better and it only cost $16.88.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loud, C batteries, but boy does it make shuffling all my cards easier
customer_reviews.text: Bought to shuffle my rapidly growing set of Cards Against Humanity. I have to coax the cards through occasionally but it is still a LOT faster and easier than hand shuffling. The unit is loud when operating and requires C batteries which makes it the only thing in my house that does.... but still enjoy it and would recommend for anyone who has the need to shuffle large amounts of cards often
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken when it arrived but easily fixed
customer_reviews.text: I knew it was a cheap machine when I bought it, considering a good shuffler costs around $100 minimum. When I got it only the gears on one side would turn. I took apart the mechanism and found that a wire wasn't connected between the left and right sides. Once I reconnected the wire though, the shuffler worked great for the price I paid! Definitely recommend if you're looking for a cheap way to quickly shuffle cards.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Gideon

customer_reviews.title: Great item for the price.  Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Using for Hand & Foot card games. Hubby hated shuffling so many cards. For the price, it works great. I was hesitant to purchase due to low cost but has exceeded our expectations. Once in a while we "pulse" the shuffler instead of continuously holding down the shuffle bar due to minor jamming. The pulse method seems to prevent it getting jammed. The gears are plastic but the roller is rubber. I imagine we can clean the roller if it stops pulling the cards through.
customer_reviews.author: Pamanc

customer_reviews.title: Was great while it worked.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this shuffler in May, 2019 It's been used gently, adults only, maybe 12 times. As of today, Aug. 25, 2019, it no longer works. It sounds like the motor has died, or is dying. I've changed the batteries, no difference. We had one years ago and it worked fine for years, that's why I purchased this one. Not happy at all with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must for anyone that owns "Cards Against Humanity"
customer_reviews.text: Really a must for anyone that owns "Cards Against Humanity" with the expansion packs. There are a TON of cards and its just a burden to try and actually shuffle them by hand. The shuffler is pretty loud when you run it and it's really cheap feeling plastic. It does on occasion mis-feed the cards and cause a jam that's pretty quick and easy to clear. All in all though and for the money and the connivence it offers, its a solid buy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work Well for Magic: The Gathering Cards
customer_reviews.text: Bought this shuffler to shuffle Magic: The Gathering cards, which are slightly smaller than average poker cards. The product is lightweight and felt very cheap. Very easy to use. Just put cards in each half and push the lever. It shuffled about half the deck, and then the last half just kind of flopped over on top of the shuffled cards. I don't know if this is because I wasn't using regulation-size playing cards or if it's just a crappy product, but I am returning because it's more of a hassle than shuffling by hand for my particular needs. The shuffler is not too noisy though, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Carly R.

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy, but a little rough around the edges
customer_reviews.text: This shuffler works quite well with my newly purchased plastic KEM cards. While the shuffler will sometimes put cards down along the sides of the shuffled deck, this isn't too much of a problem considering we are shuffling a full six decks. This has been a huge time saver in our games of progressive rummy where we use a lot of decks. It is definitely made out of cheap plastic, and I can see why many reviewers have complained that the small black clips that hold the deck tray in place have broken. So far, it is holding up well, but we treat it with tenderness. All in all, I'm pretty satisfied with it considering the great price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: shuffle em boys
customer_reviews.text: These are replacements for a couple of worn out shufflers. So far they work great. They are used mostly for Wednesday's Hand and Foot games. That is six decks to shuffle. A lot of bang for the bucks. They are not heavy duty commercial type shufflers but for medium normal use we expect to get a couple of years out of them. The last ones that look exactly like these have lasted over 3 years being used every week. I would have to give these a recommendation on there shear dollar value.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Florida

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Shuffles about 4 decks at a time. Really does not do 6 at a time. There are always some left, and it looks like about 2 decks worth. Came reasonably fast, but not on time. In fairness it was Christmas rush time, so I am not too concerned. This thing really does shuffle the cards well. A lot easier than having 4 people all shuffle and then trade and then do it again etc... I have had it about 3 weeks, so no info on length of service limits. If it goes bad I will revise this review.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Krebs

customer_reviews.title: 6 Deck Shuffler
customer_reviews.text: It is so nice to put so many cards in at one time and have it shuffle them all. Batteries seem to last a long time in this also! I am in charge of getting them if a member of my card group needs one and I always get the 6 deck one!
customer_reviews.author: Luvmycards

customer_reviews.title: Beats shuffling by hand by a mile, but does Jam sometimes
customer_reviews.text: Beats shuffling by hand by a mile, but jams sometimes, flips 3-5 cards often, still not a big deal. We use it to play Hand & Foot, 5 decks for 4 players, I run all 5 decks through 3 times each hand in about 2 minutes with the usual 2-3 jams and 3-5 cards flipped (sometimes none). Bottom line I would buy this again, it saves so much time, cheaply made, but it works and was cheap to buy. Batteries lasted approx. 4000-5000 shuffles, but that's a guess, based on 4 hands x 3 shuffles per hand x 3 games, once a week for 1 year.

customer_reviews.title: For the money it is okay

customer_reviews.title: Hand & Foot
customer_reviews.text: This toy is a card shuffler and is used by adults when playing card games. It performs very well for shuffling 5 decks. It's best feature is that it does not have feet like the other style. Therefore the battery compartment covers stay on. They could be made differently so that the batteries do not fall out when used. I has to rig a cover for the bottom & tape it on the other version to keep the covers on the battery compartments. This one works much better. I think that one shuffled 3 decks.

product_meta.title: John N. Hansen Six-Deck Automatic Card Shuffler
product_meta.description: The Six-Deck Automatic Card Shuffler is a superfast way to shuffle cards, so you can get back to the game in no time. Simply load half the cards to be shuffled into the left side, half into the right side... and push one button. Within seconds, your cards are shuffled and ready to deal. Works with up to six decks of standard poker-sized cards or narrower bridge-style cards. Ideal for children, seniors or anyone who finds it difficult to shuffle cards. Cards not included.
feature_bullets: Works with standard (poker-sized) cards and narrower bridge cards
